	We&#39;re seeking a vibrant and creative Social Media &amp; Content Officer to take our online presence to the next level.

Social Media Management:


	Manage and grow Tamak&rsquo;s presence on Twitter (X) and Instagram with daily posts/tweets, engaging content, and active interaction with followers.

	Collaborate with other team members on creative and visually appealing content (graphics, reels, tweets, etc.) aligned with brand tone.

	Social media savvy with experience managing business pages
	Creativity, consistency, and the ability to think like a brand
	Must reside in Lagos and be available for in-person content work when needed.

	Basic graphic design skills (Canva, Capcut, PixlrPhotoshop, etc.)
	Experience with social media and Googleads and basic analytics tools
	Familiarity with logistics, delivery services, or urban youth culture.

N60,000 - N100,000 monthly.

Social Media & Content Officer Job at Tamak Logistics




        
    

        
        Tamak Logistics is a fast-growing delivery and mobility company based in Lagos, providing top-notch dispatch and logistics solutions. We're seeking a vibrant and creative Social Media & Content Officer to take our online presence to the next level.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media & Content Officer

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We're seeking a vibrant and creative Social Media & Content Officer to take our online presence to the next level.


Responsibilities
As the Social Media & Content Officer, you will be responsible for the following:
Social Media Management:


	Manage and grow Tamak’s presence on Twitter (X) and Instagram with daily posts/tweets, engaging content, and active interaction with followers.
	Respond promptly to DMs, mentions, comments, and community conversations.


Content Creation & Planning:


	Collaborate with other team members on creative and visually appealing content (graphics, reels, tweets, etc.) aligned with brand tone.
	Schedule and manage a content calendar with weekly plans and thematic campaigns.


Digital Campaigns:


	Manage all Google Ads and Social Media Ad campaigns.
	Analyze ad performance and optimize for better visibility and lead generation.


Growth & Community Engagement:


	Grow our followers and improve audience engagement across platforms.
	Implement interactive contents (polls, challenges, giveaways, etc.)


Performance Reporting:


	Provide weekly performance reports and insights.
	Recommend and implement improvements basedonmetrics.


Requirements & Skills


	Interested candidates should possess an HND or Bachelor’s Degree with 1 - 3 years of work experience.
	Excellent command of English with a strong sense of humor and wordplay
	Social media savvy with experience managing business pages
	Creativity, consistency, and the ability to think like a brand
	Must reside in Lagos and be available for in-person content work when needed.


Added Advantage:


	Basic graphic design skills (Canva, Capcut, PixlrPhotoshop, etc.)
	Experience with social media and Googleads and basic analytics tools
	Familiarity with logistics, delivery services, or urban youth culture.


Salary
N60,000 - N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs and applications to: tamakrecruitment@gmail.com using "Social Media & Content Officer" as the subject of the mail.

Visual Communications Assistant Job at Plan International




        
    

        
        Plan International is an independent development and humanitarian non-profit organisation that advances children’s rights and equality for girls. We support children’s rights from birth until they reach adulthood, and enable children to prepare for - and respond to - crises and adversity. We believe in the power and potential of every child, but know this is often suppressed by poverty, violence, exclusion and discrimination.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Visual Communications Assistant

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Fixed-Term Contract

The Opportunity
     

            
    




	The Visual Communications Assistant will support the Philanthropy Directorate’s storytelling, visibility, and campaign efforts by producing compelling visual content that communicates Plan International Nigeria’s impact. This includes photography, videography, motion graphics, and graphic design services for program communications, social media, campaigns, events, and internal use.
	The role ensures visual assets are high-quality, brand-aligned, and contribute to strategic visibility, donor engagement, and public mobilisation objectives.
	The assistant works closely with the Brand & Communications Manager and supports both planned and real-time storytelling opportunities.


About You
We are looking to recruit applicant with:


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree in Media, Fine Arts, Communications, Graphic Design, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
	2 - 3 years of experience in photography, videography, and design in a professional or organisational setting.
	Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, After Effects) or similar tools.
	Strong visual storytelling skills, with a creative eye and attention to detail.
	Willingness to travel to project sites across Nigeria.
	Strong ethics and sensitivity to working with children, communities, and vulnerable populations.
	Experience working in a non-profit, humanitarian, or advocacy organisation.
	Excellent organisation, multitasking, and time management abilities.
	Understanding of visual brand identity systems and working with brand guidelines.
	Familiarity with social media formats and emerging content trends (e.g., reels, animations).
	Fluency in written and spoken English; knowledge of local languages is a plus.
